page.title: 12NEWBURY AGRICULTURAL SHOW
page.content: Each year the Newbury and District Agricultural Society holds a big show. In 1985 the Society has acquired a permanent site at Prior's Court of approximately 130 acres. At the show there are around 400 stands, but if all the small exhibitors in the flower tent, the food marquee and the rural craft tent are included the number increases to nearer 550. Attractions for 1985 include a festival of transport, two military bands, the Red Devils parachute team, hot air balloons, heavy horses and show jumping. At each show there are competitions for horses, cattle, sheep, goats, and pigs. In addition there are competitions for growing crops and the best farmed farm.
